description: Unique identifier of the work order that this task belongs to.
Identifier of the asset (vehicle or equipment) serviced by this task.
Identifier for the specific task line within the work order or a standard task code; confirm with SME.
Sequence number determining the order this task is executed or displayed within the work order.
System-generated unique key for the task record; sometimes unused in legacy data.
Completion indicator for the task (e.g., 1 = complete).
Human-readable description of the task, typically including category and component details.
Type of result captured for the task (e.g., pass/fail, numeric, text); likely used for inspections; confirm with SME.
Type of meter associated with the task (e.g., miles, hours, km) used for readings or thresholds; confirm with SME.
Free-text result or outcome recorded when completing the task.
Reference to linked attachments (photos, documents) related to this task.
Technician notes or comments entered upon task completion.
Business rule or calculation formula applied to the task’s measurements or costs; likely configurable; confirm with SME.
Flag indicating whether the task is mandatory to complete the work order or meet compliance.
Timestamp when the task was marked complete.
Portion of the work order’s cost allocated to this task (amount or percentage); confirm with SME.
User who created the task record.
Timestamp when the task record was created.
User who last modified the task record.
Timestamp of the most recent update to the task record.
Geospatial geometry capturing the task’s location (point/line/polygon), if tracked; often null in shop tasks.
User who completed or signed off the task.
Estimated labor hours required to perform the task.
Percent complete at task start for progress tracking; likely used with inspections; confirm with SME.
Percent complete when the task finished; used for progress tracking; confirm with SME.
Direction or department/accounting code used to categorize or route the task; meaning may be organization-specific; confirm with SME.
Identifier linking the task to a stored geometry object in a GIS or spatial table.
User-defined text field for custom codes or notes related to the task.
